name: Postpartum Core Rebuild & Strength Foundation
description: An 8-week progressive strength program designed specifically for postpartum recovery with diastasis recti considerations. This program rebuilds core stability from the inside out while safely restoring full-body strength using home equipment with quiet, baby-nap-friendly exercises.

phases.name: Foundation & Core Reconnection
phases.focus: Rebuild deep core stability, restore mind-muscle connection, and establish safe movement patterns
phases.explanation: This phase prioritizes healing your diastasis recti while rebuilding foundational strength. We focus on deep core activation (transverse abdominis), diaphragmatic breathing patterns, and controlled movements that create intra-abdominal pressure safely. All exercises are selected to avoid excessive forward abdominal pressure that could worsen separation.
phases.expectations: You may feel like the exercises are 'too easy' at first - this is intentional. Expect to feel deep core muscles activating that you may have lost connection with. Some muscle soreness is normal, but stop if you notice coning/doming of your abdomen during any exercise. Energy levels may fluctuate with postpartum demands.
keyPoints: Focus on exhaling during exertion to engage deep core
Stop any exercise if you see abdominal coning or doming
Quality over quantity - slower reps with full control
Listen to your body and rest when needed

workouts.name: Full Body A - Lower Focus
workouts.focus: Lower body strength with core integration

activities: Diaphragmatic breathing lying down - 10 deep breaths
Glute bridges with breath focus - 8 reps
Supine spinal twist - 20 seconds each side

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
exercises.notes: Focus on exhaling as you stand, keeping core gently engaged
instructions: Hold dumbbell at chest height with elbows tucked down
Push knees out over toes as you lower with control
Exhale forcefully through pursed lips as you drive up through heels

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Light weight to start - focus on hip hinge pattern
instructions: Hold dumbbells in front of thighs, soft knee bend maintained throughout
Hinge at hips pushing glutes back, keeping back flat and core braced
Exhale as you squeeze glutes to return to standing

exercises.name: Split Squat
exercises.notes: Hold wall for balance if needed, stay quiet on landing
instructions: Stagger feet front to back, most weight in front heel
Lower straight down until back knee nearly touches floor
Keep torso upright and exhale as you press through front foot to rise

exercises.name: Glute Bridge with March
exercises.notes: Core stability exercise - keep hips level throughout
instructions: Bridge up squeezing glutes, creating straight line from knees to shoulders
Slowly lift one foot 2 inches off ground, maintaining level hips
Lower foot with control, alternate sides - each lift is one rep

exercises.name: Dead Bug
exercises.notes: Essential DR-safe core exercise - stop if any coning occurs
instructions: Lie on back with knees at 90 degrees, arms reaching to ceiling
Press lower back gently into floor and exhale as you extend opposite arm and leg
Move slowly with control, inhale to return to start position

exercises.name: Pallof Press with Band
exercises.notes: Anti-rotation core work - safe for DR when done correctly
instructions: Anchor band at chest height, hold with both hands at sternum
Exhale and press band straight out, resisting rotation
Hold for 2 seconds at full extension, return with control

workouts.name: Full Body B - Upper Focus
workouts.focus: Upper body strength with postural restoration

activities: Thread the needle stretch - 5 each side
Doorway chest stretch - 20 seconds each side

exercises.name: Bent Over Row
exercises.notes: Excellent for postpartum posture - counteracts nursing hunch
instructions: Hinge forward 45 degrees with flat back, core braced, dumbbells hanging
Pull elbows back squeezing shoulder blades together at top
Lower with 3-second control, exhale on the pull

exercises.name: Push-Up on Incline
exercises.notes: Use stairs, couch, or counter - higher surface is easier
instructions: Hands shoulder width on elevated surface, body in straight plank line
Lower chest toward surface with elbows at 45 degrees
Exhale and press up, keeping core tight and hips level with shoulders

exercises.name: Single Arm Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Single arm requires more core stability - great functional strength
instructions: Stand with feet hip width, dumbbell at shoulder, opposite hand on hip
Brace core and exhale as you press straight overhead
Control the descent for 3 seconds, keep ribs from flaring

exercises.name: Band Face Pull
exercises.notes: Critical for shoulder health and posture
instructions: Anchor band at face height, grip with palms down
Pull toward face while rotating hands to palms-forward position
Squeeze shoulder blades and hold for 2 seconds at peak contraction

exercises.name: Bird Dog
exercises.notes: Core stability essential - keep hips and shoulders level
instructions: Start on hands and knees, wrists under shoulders, knees under hips
Exhale and extend opposite arm and leg while keeping back flat
Move slowly, hold for 2 seconds, return with control

exercises.name: Side-Lying Hip Abduction
exercises.notes: Important for pelvic stability, can add band for progression
instructions: Lie on side with hips stacked, bottom knee bent for stability
Keep top leg straight and lift toward ceiling leading with heel
Lower with control, keep hips from rolling backward

workouts.name: Full Body C - Metabolic Circuit
workouts.focus: Full body conditioning with core integration

activities: Figure four stretch - 30 seconds each side
Kneeling hip flexor stretch - 20 seconds each side

exercises.name: Sumo Squat
exercises.notes: Wide stance targets inner thighs and glutes
instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulders, toes turned out 45 degrees
Hold single dumbbell at chest or between legs
Sit back and down keeping knees tracking over toes, exhale to stand

exercises.name: Floor Press
exercises.notes: Floor limits range of motion - shoulder friendly pressing
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent, dumbbells pressed above chest
Lower until upper arms touch floor, elbows at 45 degrees
Pause briefly on floor, exhale and press up with control

exercises.name: Reverse Lunge
exercises.notes: Step back quietly for sleeping baby - control the movement
instructions: Step back with one leg, lowering until both knees at 90 degrees
Keep front knee stacked over ankle, torso upright
Push through front heel to return, exhale on the effort

exercises.name: Renegade Row - Modified
exercises.notes: From knees if needed - focus on zero hip rotation
instructions: Start in push-up position on dumbbells, feet wide for stability
Row one dumbbell to hip while pressing other into floor
Keep hips completely still and square to ground throughout

exercises.name: Banded Good Morning
exercises.notes: Posterior chain activation - great for lower back health
instructions: Stand on band with feet hip width, loop over back of neck
Hinge at hips pushing glutes back, slight knee bend
Squeeze glutes and exhale to return to standing

exercises.name: Diaphragmatic Breathing with Core Engagement
exercises.notes: Foundational DR rehab exercise - practice daily
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent, hands on lower belly
Inhale deeply letting belly rise, then exhale slowly
On exhale, gently draw belly button toward spine without holding breath

mealTiming: Eat a small snack 30-60 minutes before workout if possible
Stay hydrated - aim for 100+ oz water daily, especially if breastfeeding
nutrition.notes: If breastfeeding, add 300-500 calories to support milk production. Focus on nutrient-dense whole foods. Protein is critical for muscle recovery and tissue healing - aim for 25-35g per meal. Don't restrict calories too aggressively as this can impact energy, recovery, and milk supply.

progressionProtocol: Week 1-2: Learn movements, focus on breathing patterns, use lighter weights
Week 3-4: Add 1-2 reps per set or increase weight by 2-5 lbs on primary movements
Check diastasis weekly - gap should be stable or improving
If you see coning during any exercise, regress to easier variation

phases.name: Strength Building & Core Integration
phases.focus: Progressive strength increases with advanced core work and compound movement mastery
phases.explanation: Building on your foundation, this phase increases training intensity and introduces more challenging variations. Core exercises progress to dynamic movements as your deep core stability improves. We add complexity to compound lifts and begin integrating core function into strength movements rather than isolating it.
phases.expectations: You should feel noticeably stronger and more confident in movements. The weights will feel more challenging as we push toward true strength building intensities. Your core should feel more 'connected' during daily activities. Some exercises may feel hard - that's the point now that your foundation is solid.
keyPoints: Push closer to true effort levels (RPE 7-8)
Core should automatically engage during compound lifts
Progress to harder variations when current ones feel easy
Recovery is still important - don't skip rest days

workouts.name: Strength Day A - Lower Emphasis
workouts.focus: Lower body strength with increased loading

activities: Leg swings front and side - 8 each
Lying hamstring stretch - 20 seconds each side

exercises.name: Goblet Squat with Pause
exercises.notes: 2-second pause at bottom increases difficulty significantly
instructions: Hold heavier dumbbell at chest, elbows tucked
Lower to full depth and pause for 2 full seconds at bottom
Exhale forcefully and drive up through heels without momentum

exercises.name: Single Leg Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Hold wall lightly for balance if needed, prioritize hip hinge
instructions: Hold dumbbell in opposite hand of standing leg
Hinge forward while floating back leg behind as counterbalance
Keep hips square to ground, exhale to squeeze glute and return

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.notes: Rear foot on couch - stay quiet, control the movement
instructions: Rear foot elevated on couch behind you, front foot stepped out
Lower straight down until front thigh parallel to ground
Keep torso upright, exhale and press through front heel to rise

exercises.name: Hip Thrust
exercises.notes: Upper back on couch, dumbbell on hip crease
instructions: Position upper back on couch edge, feet flat, dumbbell on hips
Drive through heels squeezing glutes at top, creating straight line from knees to shoulders
Lower with control for 3 seconds, avoid arching lower back at top

exercises.name: Dead Bug with Band Resistance
exercises.notes: Loop band around hands and feet for added resistance
instructions: Press band outward with hands and feet to create tension
Maintain tension while extending opposite arm and leg
Exhale fully during extension, keep lower back pressed to floor

exercises.name: Side Plank - Modified
exercises.notes: From knees is fine - watch for coning, stop if it occurs
instructions: Stack knees and prop on forearm, lift hips creating straight line
Keep top hip stacked directly over bottom hip, no rotation
Breathe normally and keep core engaged without bearing down

workouts.name: Strength Day B - Upper Emphasis
workouts.focus: Upper body strength with progressive overload

activities: Upper trap stretch - 20 seconds each side

exercises.name: Bent Over Row - Heavier
exercises.notes: Increase weight from Phase 1 - challenge yourself
instructions: Hinge to 45 degrees maintaining flat back and braced core
Pull with elbows driving back, squeeze shoulder blades for 1 second at top
Lower with 3 second control, maintain body position throughout

exercises.name: Push-Up - Standard or Deficit
exercises.notes: Progress to floor push-ups or hands on books for deficit
instructions: Full plank position with hands just outside shoulders
Lower chest to floor or past hands if using deficit
Keep body in straight line throughout, exhale on the press

exercises.name: Arnold Press
exercises.notes: Seated on floor or standing - both work well
instructions: Start with dumbbells at shoulders, palms facing you
Press up while rotating palms to face forward at the top
Reverse the rotation as you lower with control

exercises.name: Chin-Up Negative or Band Assisted
exercises.notes: Jump to top, lower for 5-second negative, or use band assistance
instructions: Grip bar with palms facing you, shoulder width apart
Jump or step to top position with chin over bar
Lower yourself as slowly as possible for 5+ seconds

exercises.name: Tricep Overhead Extension
exercises.notes: Single dumbbell held with both hands overhead
instructions: Hold one dumbbell overhead with both hands, elbows close to head
Lower dumbbell behind head by bending elbows only
Extend arms fully, squeezing triceps at top

exercises.name: Bicep Curl to Press
exercises.notes: Combination movement for efficiency
instructions: Curl dumbbells to shoulders with palms up
At top of curl, rotate palms forward and press overhead
Reverse the motion with control back to start

workouts.name: Strength Day C - Total Body Power
workouts.focus: Full body compound movements with metabolic component

activities: Deep breathing with core connection - 5 breaths

exercises.name: Dumbbell Deadlift
exercises.notes: Conventional stance, dumbbells at sides - use your heaviest weights
instructions: Stand with feet hip width, dumbbells outside thighs
Hinge at hips and lower dumbbells along legs keeping back flat
Drive through heels, squeeze glutes at top, exhale on the lift

exercises.name: Single Arm Floor Press
exercises.notes: Single arm adds core anti-rotation challenge
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent, single dumbbell pressed above shoulder
Lower until upper arm touches floor, opposite hand on ground for stability
Press up while resisting rotation, keep hips grounded

exercises.name: Step Up
exercises.notes: Use stairs - step quietly, control the movement
instructions: Place entire foot on step, drive through heel to stand up
Bring trailing leg up without pushing off ground
Lower with control, same leg leads for all reps then switch

exercises.name: Renegade Row - Full
exercises.notes: Full plank position now - wide feet for stability
instructions: High plank on dumbbells, feet wider than hip width
Row one dumbbell while pressing other firmly into ground
Keep hips absolutely still, alternate sides with control

exercises.name: Pallof Press with Step
exercises.notes: Add lateral step while pressing for increased difficulty
instructions: Set up for standard Pallof press with band at chest height
As you press band out, take a lateral step away from anchor
Step back in as you return hands to chest, maintain tension throughout

exercises.name: Plank with Shoulder Tap
exercises.notes: Anti-rotation core challenge - keep hips completely still
instructions: Full plank position with feet wide for stability
Tap opposite shoulder while pressing firmly through grounded hand
Move slowly, minimize any hip shift or rotation

mealTiming: Pre-workout: Complex carbs + protein 1-2 hours before
Post-workout: Protein + carbs within 1-2 hours after
Spread protein intake across 4-5 eating occasions
nutrition.notes: Slight calorie increase to support increased training intensity. Protein bumped to 150g to support muscle building. If energy is low during workouts, add a small carb-focused snack 30 minutes before. Continue prioritizing hydration - performance drops significantly when dehydrated.

progressionProtocol: Week 5-6: Establish new working weights, aim for RPE 7 on compound lifts
Week 7-8: Push to RPE 8 on primary lifts, add weight when all reps completed with good form
Add 2.5-5 lbs to lower body lifts, 2.5 lbs to upper body when ready
Core exercises: progress to harder variations or add time/reps
